text: حتى اذا اخذنا مترفيهم بالعذاب اذا هم يجـرون

translations.translation: But then when We seize the affluent among them with the punishment, they will suddenly start praying fervently.
So that when We seize the affluent among them with affliction, they will begin to implore for help.
until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways. They will then begin to groan.
But when We will strike with torment those (unbelievers) who are rich, they will start to cry for help.
To the extent that when We seized the wealthy among them with punishment, they immediately began imploring.
Until when We seize those of them who lead a luxurious life with punishment; behold, they make humble invocation with a loud voice.
Until when We overtake those who lead easy lives among them with punishment, lo! they cry for succor.
Till, when We seize with the chastisement the ones of them that live at ease, behold, they groan.
Till when We grasp their luxurious ones with the punishment, behold! they supplicate.
But then when We seize the affluent among them, they will cry out for help.
Until when We lay hold of the luxuriant ones of them with the torment, and lo! then they are imploring!
When We seize their affluent ones with punishment, behold, they make entreaties [to Us].
Until, when We seize in Punishment those of them who received the good things of this world, behold, they will groan in supplication!
Until, when We grasp those of them who lead a luxurious life with punishment, behold! They make humble invocation with a loud voice.
But when We seize with the punishment those of them that live in ease, they groan.
Until, when We seize the decadent among them with torment, they begin to groan.
Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.

[23:64] Indeed (hattā is for inceptiveness) when We seize their affluent ones, their wealthy and their leaders, with chastisement, [with] the sword, on the day of Badr, behold! they are supplicating loudly, clamouring [in supplication]. It is [then] said to them:

(Till when We grasp their luxurious ones) their tyrants and leaders: Abu Jahl Ibn Hisham, al-Walid Ibn al- Mughirah al-Makhzumi, al-'As Ibn Wa'il al-Sahmi, 'Utbah and Shaybah and their friends (with the punishment) with hunger for seven years, (behold! they supplicate) they plead.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِمْ بِٱلْعَذَابِ } يعني بالمترفِ: المَوسّعِ عليه في الدّنيا حتّى بَغوا وكَفروا
 والعَذابُ: بالسّيفِ يَوم بَدر




وقوله تعالى: { يَجْأَرُونَ } معناه يَرفَعونَ أَصواتُهم

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { حَتَّىٰ إِذَآ أَخَذْنَا مُتْرَفِيهِمْ } ومتنعميهم { بِٱلْعَذَابِ إِذَا هُمْ يَجْأَرُونَ } [المؤمنون: 64] أي: يستغيثون ويستعينون؛ يعني هم في الراحة والرضا عنا غافلون، وإذا أخذناهم بالبلاء والعناء، فأجاءوا إلى الاستغاثة والاستعانة منا، منصرفين إلينا، متضرعين نحونا

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { إذا هم يجأرون } أي: يصرخون استغاثة، والجؤار: الصراخ باستغاثة
